body_html: @dandelionmane We don't want links to docs_src -- they are source files and are not necessarily readable. tensorflow.org is the source of truth for docs and should be the target of links. The main exception is if you are modifying something in docs_src or in a comment that will end up in the API docs, then you should use the new @{...} syntax (described in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/g3doc ) for links when possible.
body_text: @dandelionmane We don't want links to docs_src -- they are source files and are not necessarily readable.  tensorflow.org is the source of truth for docs and should be the target of links.  The main exception is if you are modifying something in docs_src or in a comment that will end up in the API docs, then you should use the new @{...} syntax (described in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/g3doc ) for links when possible.
body: @dandelionmane We don't want links to docs_src -- they are source files and are not necessarily readable.  tensorflow.org is the source of truth for docs and should be the target of links.  The main exception is if you are modifying something in docs_src or in a comment that will end up in the API docs, then you should use the new @{...} syntax (described in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/g3doc ) for links when possible.
